All Classes

Class Summary 
Class Description
Ball
This represents a single Ball, which can be instantiated and rendered on the screen.
Brick
This represents a single Brick, which can be instantiated and rendered on the screen.
CementBrick
Inherits and implements abstract methods from the Brick Class.
ClayBrick
Inherits and implements abstract methods from the Brick Class.
Crack
Rendered when the Ball collides with a CementBrick with insufficient impact.
DebugConsoleController
This is the Controller for the DebugConsole, which allows the user to skip levels and change the number of balls.
DebugConsoleModel
This is the Model for the DebugConsole, which allows the user to skip levels and change the number of balls.
DebugConsoleView
This is the View for the DebugConsole, which allows the user to skip levels and change the number of balls.
GameBoardController
This is the Controller for the GameBoard, which renders the screen in which the user will play the game.
GameBoardModel
This is the Model for the GameBoard, which renders the screen in which the user will play the game.
GameBoardView
This is the View for the GameBoard, which renders the screen in which the user will play the game.
GameFrame
The JFrame in which all other objects will be rendered.
HighScore  
HomeMenuController
This is the Controller for the HomeMenu, which is the introductory screen.
HomeMenuModel
This is the Model for the HomeMenu, which renders the introductory screen.
HomeMenuView
This is the View for the HoemMenu, which renders the screen in which the user will play the game.
Main
The main class and method.
Player
This represents a single Player, which can be instantiated and rendered on the screen.
RubberBall
Inherits and implements abstract methods from the Ball class.
SteelBrick
Inherits and implements abstract methods from the Brick Class.
Wall
This represents a single Wall, which can be instantiated and rendered on the screen.
